messages.message: hitting this error on our website

it seems that our marketing website is down? going to instabase.com (http://instabase.com) also doesn’t work @aristo

this `/request-demo` route directs to our `WORDPRESS_BACKEND` , so if something is wrong with our marketing site, this route won’t work either

cc @Ashwin
@nikita @Bas
@Alex can you see if any change just got made?
Seems whole website is down… Which suggests an infra problem
@jtau anything that has changed recently in infra that could pull the marketing site down?
It looks to be up for me
looks like its working again. could there have been some update to prod that took it offline for a few mins?
That seems a likely cause indeed
i know @Dave was looking into making some changes? https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01N7DV1137/p1695660987164249
Yea there was no changes on the marketo side of things
@Ashwin :eyes:
@Tom - forms and site are back on again. We’ll have to figure out what happened though to time this better if it is part of a regular deployment
There is a push to prod that happens every Tuesday morning … it could be that
Let’s verify if it is. If so, then prime time for our global markets is not ideal to have our website unavailable :laughing:

I don't think wordpress gets redeployed with the rest of the platform. Though the cpu and memory stats dropped almost to 0 for about 10 minutes earlier: https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/us-central1-c/instabase-main-prod-[…]overview?q=search&referrer=search&project=instabase-main (https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/us-central1-c/instabase-main-prod-002/ib-marketing/wordpress/overview?q=search&referrer=search&project=instabase-main)

I wonder if it's the node getting rotated again
@Serena just discussions, nothing was teed up for changes so you can rule that out as a possible cause.
Definitely a bunch of container restarts for 10 mins.
I can't access prod.jenkins right now :disappointed: it keeps redirecting me to okta... @shiqi can you help see if this corresponds to a prod deploy?
Some weird errors showing up on wordpress.

This could be related to some external shutdown causing the wordpress container to crash - who would be the best person to consult about spot/pre-emptible(?) instances to see if that might be related?
@jtau you can try logout okta and then log back in, it is a known issue with okta session and prod jenkins session out of sync occasionally
Based on the error message seems like an issue with apache https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=50669

Also, it seems like a lot of our wordpress issues occur because we manage our own infra. My understanding is we did this to support instabase.com (http://instabase.com) pointing to both the platform and the marketing site. Have we considered switching to a managed wordpress instance on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) and then moving the platform to something like platform.instabase.com (http://platform.instabase.com)?
This setup also causes the security issues that @Dave correctly pointed out. Wouldn’t we over time move to AiHub.instabase.com (http://AiHub.instabase.com) for the product anyway?

Fwiw, I've had good experiences with services like WP Engine at my previous company.

https://wpengine.com/

(should we be thinking of rehoming to a hosted option)
